fields.description: What are all those animated textblocks for? Everytime i click on a file or a revision, the diffview has some animation. This is very annoying. Furthermore, the text in the diff view is quite blurry while the animation is executed, and it needs nearly a second to become readable, even after the moving of the textlock stops.
fields.summary: Diff-View animation is annoying

fields.description: I regularly switch from my IDE / editor to SourceTree. Since I updated from 1.x to version 2.x whenever I switch to SourceTree e.g. via alt-tab the entire application freezes for several seconds. sourcetree.log does not produce any log entries when just switching to the SourceTree window.
fields.summary: Freezing when window switching from another application

fields.description:
In previous SourceTree clients the doubleclick on a file just opened it with the Windows associated program for that extension. With the new 2.0.20.1 version this is just possible now in the context menu selecting "Open Selected Version".

This is a medium usability degradation for us because most of our team used to open files regularly using the doubleclick and switching to SourceTree 2.x reported as an issue.
fields.summary: Doubleclick on file in selected commit should open it like "Open Selected Version"

fields.description:
Clicking "Log selected" on a file only displays history for the current branch. There should be an option in the "log selected" popup to display it for all branches (in command line git, you type git log --all myfile.txt)

The fact that only current checked out branch is display is especially disturbing when you click "log selected" from a specified commit, and if that commit isn't in the current branch, it's not displayed in the popup.
fields.summary: "Log selected" should display history in all branches

fields.description:
The workflow would be enhanced by putting the cursor on the "search" field when opening a new tab with the 2.x repository selector.

Now, if you Ctrl+T, you have to get back to the mouse to click on the search field then get back to keyboard to type then get back to the mouse to click on the filtered element.

Ability to search for a repository is great, it just needs better usability.
fields.summary: .Set focus on search field when opening a new tab

fields.description:
I get that you want to push a new UI theme, and I guess I need to live with it like I someday have to live with the ugly windows 10 kind of UI.

But it would be nice if you could remove some of the inconsistencies which are really ugly to look at (aside from the bad font rendering, but there are already tickets for that).

I've made a compilation of screenshots to show some of the things which are out of whack.

For example:
 * Font-Sizes seem to be completely random
 * UI Styles differ completely in different sections (the "new tab" UIs for example look like windows 10 "simplified control panel", while the rest still looks like normal UI.
 * The flat look is not used everywhere, which makes the look completely unballanced (windows 7 here, so maybe this is not on win10)
 * even on the flat ui, looks differ a lot
 * the left sidebar icon look like they have different sizes. just compare the cloud icon and the PC monitor icon.

Marked this minor, since the font-rendering/animation issues and the windows-10-we-don't-need-visual-cues are the issues that really keep me from being productive, while this is only ugly to look at.

(Thanks for all the work you put into SourceTree, aside from the new UI I'm a huge fan)
fields.summary: New UI inconsistency

fields.description:
Text and Icons are overlapping

!image-2017-05-14-14-08-56-010.png!
fields.summary: Text and Icons overlapping in Branch Tree on left side

fields.description:
I would like to suggest to bring back the "counter icons" from previous versions. They were very practical to have a summary of what happened in the repository. I attach a picture to clarify what icons I have in mind.

!image_2017-05-13_16-08-52.png!

Thank you for your help!
fields.summary: Restore counter icons in repository tree

fields.description:
When trying to install SourceTree 20.0.20.1, in third step "Atlassian account", on log in screen, I'm getting "Oops, you've made a malformed request." message. Don't know what happend. It seems, that my account is working, althrough I've never get "e-mail verification" e-mail, but I did get "reset password" e mail. I've tried on to mails, [pisakpisze@gmail.com|mailto:pisakpisze@gmail.com] and [malec.krzysztof.work@gmail.com|mailto:malec.krzysztof.work@gmail.com] , same issue. I've tried to check in Windows Firewall, nothing there. I can't use "Log in with Google" button, nothing happend when pressed. Tried to use random account name, getting same message. I've event tried to delete cookies, uninstall browser extensions(Google Chrome), tried to use different-older SourceTree (1.9.6.0 and some older one, don't remember), same issue.

Don't have firewall, anti-virus software etc. I can't even attach file in png and bmp formats!
fields.summary: Can't install SourceTree

fields.description:
On at least four machines with the following configuration:
* Windows 10 in Polish language
* SourceTree (currently 2.1.0.2, but also in older versions)
* Spell checking enabled in options, English/US language selected

spell checking didn't work (typos weren't emphasised in any way).
I found a workaround: installing English language pack for Windows 10 made spell checking work immediately. Language pack does not have to be set as the currently used one, it's enough that it's installed. Perhaps some dictionaries coming with .NET Framework Language Packs are used?
fields.summary: Commit spell checking doesn't work on non-english Windows OS installations

fields.description:
I work on multiple copies of the same repo but on different branches (due to build times)

In sourcetree once I add each repository as a tab each has the same name and I can get easily confused about which one is which,

Is there a way to change the name of the tab, or add the path?

I tried changing the name on the + tab but when I open it, it doesn't keep the name I gave it on the + tab, and just has the repository name
fields.summary: Can't Tell Multiple Copies of Repository Apart - Need Change Tab Name or Show Tab Path

fields.description: I work a lot in Visual Studio in the evening and switched to a dark theme, because it is more convenient to look at. But I also switch a lot between SourceTree and Visual Studio, so the contrast is pretty big. It would be great to be able to switch to a dark theme, just like Visual Studio can.
fields.summary: Support dark theme

fields.description: The icons in the tree panel are too large for the window
fields.summary: Icons in tree panel are not sized correctly

fields.description:
* I can't reliably reproduce it, but I do have a process dump.
 * Closing the tab and trying to reopen it did not help.
 * I noticed because my laptop's fans spun up and didn't stop

I have a 140MB, 7-zipped process dump (orig size was over 1GB). Is there any way I can get this to you? Attachment limit is 10MB here.
fields.summary: Hang on "fetching older commits" with high CPU usage

fields.description:
*Summary*

Everytime I give focus back to SourceTree (after working in another app) it hangs for over 30 seconds. While I'm working in SourceTree there are no performance issues, everything works nicely.

*Environment*

Windows 10

SourceTree 2.0.19.1 and later

*Solution*

Make sure you're not bookmarking repositories that no longer exist. 

When SourceTree gets focus again and wakes up, it restarts background processes that monitor the local filesystem in each bookmark and also query their remotes. Once you remove the non-existent repositories, this problem no longer occurs.
fields.summary: SourceTree slow on getting focus

fields.description:
think the problem is that it does not display the file mode changes:
$ git diff --cached
diff --git a/Build/build_debug32.sh b/Build/build_debug32.sh
old mode 100644
new mode 100755
diff --git a/Build/build_debug64.sh b/Build/build_debug64.sh
old mode 100644
new mode 100755
diff --git a/Build/build_release32.sh b/Build/build_release32.sh
old mode 100644
new mode 100755
diff --git a/Build/build_release64.sh b/Build/build_release64.sh
old mode 100644
new mode 100755
diff --git a/Build/clean.sh b/Build/clean.sh
old mode 100644
new mode 100755
diff --git a/Build/scd-centos.xml b/Build/scd-centos.xml
index be6ada9..92d394d 100644
That's why I think it does not show file changes in the UI

The compare window compares the version on disk with the version from the merging branch not the current branch
fields.summary: When merging with --no-commit, when you select the uncommited changes dot, in the staged files area, if you select a file, there is no compare detected.

fields.description:
When switching branches in the repository sidebar users are prompted by a dialog asking for them to confirm they want to switch branches.

a) This behaviour seems inconsistent between double-clicking on a branch and using the menu option, the confirmation dialog doesn't always appear, it should be consistent.

b) It should be possible to globally disable this option. c.f. SourceTree for Mac allows this.
fields.summary: Make it possible to disable the dialog asking for confirmation when switching Branches.

fields.description:
Clicking 'Show in Explorer' on an unstaged 'directory' opens an explorer window for every unstaged 'file' in the directory and its sub directories.
Would expect only the one explorer window to open at the directory selected.
Severity set to Major since I found this out when clicking on a directory with over a 1000 files in it, and had to restart OS to recover.
fields.summary: Clicking 'Show in Explorer' on an unstaged 'directory' opens an explorer window for every 'file' in the directory

fields.description: !SourceTree.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Publisher name needs to be changed to Atlassian instead of our developers' name.

fields.description:
To be clear the following issue makes SourceTree 2.0 completely unusable. I will be downgrading back to 1.9 until it is resolved.

After upgrading to SourceTree 2.0.20.1, I get a consistent problem where the SourceTree File Status tab randomly shows local change diffs against some random old version of the file (instead of against the most recent version). This leads to completely misleading diffs that don't reflect the actual changes that have been made.

If I bring up an external Diff of the file it is also against the wrong version, so clearly SourceTree is choosing the incorrect version at a low level somewhere. Stranger still, if I restart SourceTree often it will start showing the diff correctly.... only to then break again as I browse around on other changed files in the File Status UI.

I had never seen this in any version of SouceTree prior to 2.0. It literally started happening the instant I upgraded from 1.9 to 2.0.
fields.summary: File Status diff is comparing against random old versions for changed files

fields.description:
Source Tree gets blank screen when moved to a second monitor, regardless of the window being minimized or maximized. 

I've discovered this issue is dependent on the speed with which I drag the SourceTree window onto the second monitor. If I drag it *very slowly* across the point where it re-scales (as >50% of the width moves onto the second monitor) then it seems to work itself out and everything is okay. If I drag it across this point more quickly (a normal speed) then it ends up black, as previously described.
fields.summary: Blank window on second monitor

fields.description: When pusing to a Git repository with submodules, SourceTree hangs indefinitely on the "scanning submodules" stage unless the user cancels the submodule stage.
fields.summary: Push hangs on submodules

fields.description: When SourceTree 2.0.20.1 is first launched, it takes over 15 seconds before the application is actually usable. This is significantly longer than SourceTree 1.x
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.0.20.1 starts slowly

fields.description: Randomly, when pulling from a Git repository, the Log / History view does not update after the pull. Switching between tabs or repositories does not cause the view to update, and the user must quit SourceTree and launch it again
fields.summary: Log / History view does not update after pull

fields.description: The sidebar of SourceTree could be hidden in v1.x, but not in v2.x. Actually, I don't want to browse the branch info and tag list in SourceTree. Could you provide an option to hide this sidebar? Thanks.
fields.summary: Why the side bar can't be hidden?

fields.description:
With the new UI, it is difficult to manage multiple clones of a git repo that reside on my computer. And manage clones of several web-clones of a base repo together with that base repo.  All of these collapse down to the repo name, without any differentiation. I have to look at the file changes tab to find out what local directory path the tab references.

It would be fantastic if the repo tab names were the names of the remote repo and there was a hover-over that showed the full URL for that repo and the full local path of the clone on my computer.

It would be even better if there were support for me to select from among a set of remote repos and/or local clones with that name. 

This inverts the folder-structure of the left pane of the 1.x version that I had been using to manage all of my different clones. Allowing me to work with the "foo" project, then select whether I want to work in the local clone based off of my private web clone of that project, the base public project, or a clone of some other clone, etc.
fields.summary: Display full path of repository on hover-over, or provide repo selection menu

fields.description:
Needs functionality to refresh the list of remote branches to match their remote existences.

I have a list of remote branches in the app that don't disappear when that branch no longer exists on the server. Selecting the menu item 'Refresh remote status' has no effect in this regard. I have to explicitly right-click them and choose Delete. This results in the benign error that the remote branch does not exist at which point the entry disappears from the list.

Please fix this or add a new feature to bulk refresh.
fields.summary: Clean Up Remote Branch List By Existence Check

fields.description: When I am looking at File Status within source tree, the "Log selected" option is not consistently available for file when I right click. Sometimes I can click onto another file in the tree and then back to the file I am interested in and the menu option will appear. However, this is works very inconsistently. I haven't found a way to get the option to appear enabled in a consistent way.
fields.summary: "Log selected" unavailable for tracked files

fields.description:
Pressing the "Check out in SourceTree" button from bitbucket is not working in this version.

!http://i.imgur.com/oLxeBDo.png!
fields.summary: Checkout from bitbucket stopped working

fields.description: Right now, you can add a GitHub.com or Enterprise and a Bitbucket account, but you cannot add any GitLab account, hosted or otherwise.
fields.summary: Add GitLab.com to hosted repository support

fields.description: I updated to SourceTree 2.0.20.1 as per an email regarding a potential security flaw in older versions. The new version seems to be missing the Bookmarks Panel (see the screen shot from version 1.9.10.0). I find this panel very helpful as i do not want to have tons of tabs open all the time. Any chance of bringing it back, or is there another way to view bookmarked repos?
fields.summary: Bring back bookmarks

fields.description: When SourceTree is expanded to full screen, I cannot move the window by grabbing the top bar with the cursor. It is simply stuck in place and can only be reduced by using the "reduce, maximize or close" icons at the top right corner of the app.
fields.summary: Cannot reposition window when in full screen mode

fields.description: I have updated to sourcetree 2.0.20.1 as per an email i received regarding a security issue with older versions. The new version has some kinks. Notably, the icons in the sidebar are overlapping the category titles (see attached png). Not sure if it is part of the issue, but I have a 4k monitor, which in the past, had some other applications displaying icons in different sizes.
fields.summary: Icons overlap categories on sidebar

fields.description:
Currently, the revision graph is not ordered horizontally. E.g.:
{code:java}
O       Uncommited changes
| G     [feature/baz]
| |\
| | F   [feature/bar][feature/foo]
| | |
| | E
| | |\
| | | D [master]
| | | |
| |/ /
| C |   
| | |
| B |
| |/
|//
A
{code}
In large repositories, this makes important branches, such as master, hard to find. I'd suggest that one can assign some kind of weight folders (and within folders to branches) that define where to place the branch: <special: current branch> (100), <no folder> (10), <feature> (unset: 0, but feature/bar: 14.). This would give the following graph:
{code:java}
O            Uncommited changes
|     G.     [feature/baz]
|    ,+´
|   F |      [feature/bar][feature/foo]
|   | |
|   E.|
|  ,+´|
| D | |      [master]
| | | |
| | |/
| | C  
| | |
| | B
| |/
|//
A 
{code}
Folders create columns. Nodes are in the column with the highest weight. Within columns, branch weights sort the nodes.

A: Column 1   (belongs to current branch)
 B: Column 3.1 (3.x: belongs to folder feature, x.1: belongs to feature/bar)
 C: Column 3.1 (see B)
 D: Column 2   (belongs to no folder)
 E: Column 3.1 (see B)
 F: Column 3.1 (see B)
 G: Column 3.2 (3.x: belongs to folder feature, x.2: nothing else)

Not shown in the example: Branches in the same column are sorted alphabetically.

Shown in the example (and might be hard to render): The order of parents is maintained by crossing lines.

Nodes would no longer fall to the leftmost posible position but to the leftmost possible possition within their folder/group/whatever you call it. This could result in wider graphs: Imagine feature/bar never getting deleted. But when one deletes feature/bar, B, C, and G would fall to the left (feature/foo and feature/baz have the same weight but feature/baz is alphabetically before feature/foo). If you now delete feature/foo, the nodes B, C, E, F, G have the same weight. E, F would get pushed to the right to maintain parent order in G.
fields.summary: Fixed order of graphs.

fields.description:
In some conditions (where a file is not selected or are nothing to stash the explore icon in the upper right side is disabled and this is a speed bump.

In same fashion this comand lacks of shortcut or hotkeys
fields.summary: Show in Explorer Icon and Shortcut

fields.description:
When attempting to download the SourceTree for Windows installer from https://sourcetreeapp.com using Internet Explorer the .exe exension is stripped off and Windows doesn't know what to do with it.

It appears to be related to this http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2185570/internet-explorer-removes-exe-extension-from-download-when-followed-by-url-para

*Workaround*

Download with a different browser.
Or for v 2.0.20.1 it can be downloaded directly from https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-2.0.20.1.exe
fields.summary: Internet Explorer strips the .exe form the SourceTreeSetup.exe download

fields.description:
When a bookmark has been opened, the name for the folder remains cached and does not change on the opened tab until after an application restart.  Steps to reproduce:

1) Open a repository bookmark

2) Go to the open tab view (click the +)

3) Find the open repositories bookmark, right-click to Rename, and rename the folder.

4) The tab name stays the same, close and reopen and the previous name persists.

5) Close SourceTree and reopen, now the tab name updates when the bookmark is opened.
fields.summary: Bookmark Rename Cached Until Restart
Постоянное зависание SourseTree надолго

fields.description: Misaligned and oversized main icons
fields.summary: Misaligned/Oversized icons
Publisher of 2.0.20.1 changed from 'Atlassian' to 'Mike Minns, Mike Corsaro'

fields.description:
The new Local repositories tab in the new version of ST provides IMO very poor user experience. I have three major notes to it:
 # lot of wasted space - the old treeview sidebar could handle all of the work with just about 300px of width
 # this is more crucial for our usage - there are no tag names shown for repos that are in detached head state
 ## anywhere in tab for certain repository there is no displayed which tag is actually checked out, unless you want to dig into graph and hunt for the "HEAD" mark
 # blurry text in changes view - on the right side when I select some source file where something has changes, it takes about two seconds to render some of file's lines. During the process the text is blurry which I find as very uncomfortable for eyes. (the second atachment with lorem ipsum text)
fields.summary: Poor UX - SourceTree repositories overview

fields.description:
Text labels on the left pane are displaced if the text size is set to 125% in the Windows system settings. If I override the UI scaling settings in the SourceTree shortcut's "Compatibiity" tab by setting it to "System", the text labels are no longer displaced, but the whole UI is blurred.

!SourceTree 2017-05-11 08.42.32.png!
fields.summary: Text labels are displaced on the repository tab's left pane if the text size is set to 125% in Windows settings

fields.description:
Pressing the "Check out in SourceTree" button from bitbucket is not working in this version.

!http://i.imgur.com/oLxeBDo.png!
fields.summary: Checkout from bitbucket stopped working in 2.0.20.1

fields.description:
Windows 10, on my laptop, by default sets the DPI scaling to 125%. Doesn't SourceTree look beautiful? I can't change my DPI settings either, because text (in all applications) becomes fuzzy on both my laptop and external monitor, so I can't work around this problem.

!Capture.JPG!
fields.summary: Icons ignore display DPI settings
Window snapping doesn't work on Windows 10 unless you grab the window ICON
Bring back old UI / Interface

fields.description:
!image-2017-05-11-11-57-40-057.png!

What happened to SourceTree ? Used to be a decent app in 1.7 and then 1.9. Why is every other release so broken? I've just upgraded from 1.9 because of the security warning email and this version is utter crap.

Why's the treeview gone?

Another super annoying one: When the window is maximised I can't drag it by grabbing the title bar.
fields.summary: UI broken with High DPI setup

fields.description:
I think this picture tells you what I want to claim.

!sourcetree signature.png!
fields.summary: The signature signed by some personal.

fields.description: What's the story with support for CodeCommit? The FAQ is mum on the subject other than sending you to JIRA (which is why im here), and a reference to a user's blog post that no longer exists.
fields.summary: Code Commit support?

fields.description:
I updated to version 2.0.19.1. I like the new layout and enjoy the app, but there are a couple of annoyances
 
 1. I hide my task-bar, with the new app, I can't move my mouse to the bottom of the screen and have it come up. Even with a maximized screen it gives me the double arrow cursor
 
 2. I can't grab the top toolbar and drag the window to another screen. Any other app I can click on the top of the window even when maximized and drag it to another windows
 
 3. This issue has existed previous to this version. But if I do what is described in #2, grab it by the toolbar, and then "throw" it to the top of another window the window just becomes 100% black. Oddly I have 3 monitors. The laptop screen, and 2 identical ViewSonic monitors. It only happens on the 3rd monitor.
fields.summary: Problems with Window Sizing

fields.description: You used to be able to at-a-glance look at your folders and see what repos have updates to pull. But that was moved into the new tab system. Now we need to open a new tab and click through each folder to see if there are updates. It seems like the UI was updated for users that only use one repo. This is a big UX issue for people that use multiple repos.
fields.summary: Bring back folder structure on left of working Repo

fields.description:
I had a complex tree of repositories with several levels.
 On 2.0 sometimes it crashes when trying to open child folders
fields.summary: After upgrade to 2.0, i've lost the repository tree and have crashes trying to navigate subfolders

fields.description: I recently updated my SourceTree to the latest version and noticed an annoying new feature. When I select a file and the window that shows the code updates, it has an animated transition that shakes the code in to place.  The issue is that the text is blurry for about 2-3 seconds after I have clicked until it stops moving.  This is very annoying and it looks like the other sections don't have this unnecessary animation.  Could you please add an option to allow the users to turn it off?
fields.summary: No way to turn off blur effect from transition animations

fields.description:
Start the "SourceTree" v.2.0.20.1

sourcetree shows the "Mercurial not found" dialog with four options.

After pressing the "browse to the location of Mercurial on your system (if we missed it)" button, dialog closed and showed again.

(but i have hg x64 installed on my machine and it added to the PATH environment)
fields.summary: Can NOT "browse to the location of Mercurial on your system"

fields.description: SourceTree deletes changed files with long path (266 chars) from file system when a file is selected and stage selected is clicked. Staging hunks of the same file works and does not delete the file.
fields.summary: file with long path deleted when staged

fields.description:
Please, add an option to disable the automatic update check performed on every start of SourceTree.

I'm using SourceTree on a machine that is not connected to the internet. On every start, an error is shown that SourceTree failed to check for updates. I worked around it by modifying the AutoUpdater setting in SourceTree.exe.config but that does not seem like a supported way. Also, this removes the "Update" section from settings and the "Check now" button.

Not having an internet connection is one reason why one might not want to automatically update an app. Thinks that come to my mind:
 * Corporate policies often do not allow automatic updates. Did you hear about the Trojan infected version of the Avidemux installer that happened this month? Now imagine if this happens to an automatically updated tool. That's only one reason for these policies.
 * One might not want to get the work environment changed during critical phases of the development process. Do you have deadlines? I do.
 * Some people prefer to not be the first to use a new version. If you're like me, you tend to run into issues. I switched to 2.x with 2.0.20.1 and even though I really like the speed bump (and no longer having selection issues in the lists), the blurry text (SRCTREEWIN-7085) makes me feel like having motion sickness. It's so annoying that I think about downgrading. Please, don't force me to use the latest version.
 * Limited internet connections. Have you ever works offside? With a volume based plan? Like 100MB/week? Via EDGE? Every network packet counts. Trust me.
 * Privacy concerns. (On Mac, I use LittleSnitch to enforce privacy settings. Errors due to unreachable update servers are annoying.)
 * …

You get the idea: There are reasons for having auto-update turned off.
fields.summary: Add option to disable automatic update (check).

fields.description:
I just upgraded to Sourcetree 2.0 on my Windows 10 desktop. I have my taskbar set to auto-hide (it only shows if I move the mouse cursor near the bottom of the screen), and having Sourcetree in fullscreen mode prevents this.

When I move the cursor to the bottom of the screen, the cursor changes to the up-and-down-arrow "resize window" cursor, and doesn't show the taskbar.

Not a major issue at all, just a little annoying.
fields.summary: Fullscreen on Windows 10 breaks auto-hidden taskbar

fields.description:
Hello,

When I untick "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git And Mercurial config files" (Tools | Options | General), when I restart sourcetree the option has already ticked.

I use 2.0.19.1  sourcetree version.

It's a real problem because when I reopen sourcetree I lost my git config and in some case we can't use git if I lost my cfg ...
fields.summary: Option git config file not persistent

fields.description: See attached image.
fields.summary: Push branches list fail

fields.description:
Please take a look at the attachment. !overlapping.png|thumbnail!

Version: 2.0.20.1
fields.summary: UI Overlapping

fields.description: When I installed this the first time and went through registration etc, I somehow ended up with a sourcetree.license file. I kept it next to the install exe expecting that it will be used the next time I install. The laptop I was on was temporary and having hardware issues so I know I'd be on the next one soon. But now that I installed I had to go through all the same "pages" and log in at some site etc. My expectations were that installer would see and use that sourcetree.license file and just install without any hassle
fields.summary: sourcetree.license to be used for install

fields.description:
SourceTree now shows every branch (even closed ones) when loading up the side panel for a Mercurial repo. My team's repo has 1000s of branches. This makes this latest version useless when trying to navigate a repo. I will have to downgrade to an earlier version cause of this issue.
 
 First saw: 2017-5-5
 Happens every time I open source tree.
 Unknown if anyone else is experiencing it
 Steps to reproduce:
 Create a branch
 Close a branch
 Branch still appears under Branches on the left-hand panel.
 Version 2.1.0.2 Windows 10
 
 Screenshot notes:
 All highlighted branches are closed
fields.summary: Branch panel shows all closed branches

fields.description:
Dear Madam, dear Sir,
 
 we ourselves will most likely not need the patch generation feature, but I thought I'll inform you nevertheless:
 
 It seems that the generated patch oftentimes contains more commits than selected when going for the variant that's based on the log, then selecting only a little part of it (e.g. just two immediately adjacent commits); the patch is likely to contain a LOT more than just that.
 
 Kind regards
 Marcus Kruschinski
fields.summary: Patch contains more commits than selected.

fields.description: The diff view in SourceTree does not follow the selected font weight or style in options. It seems to only use the lightest weight & only non-italic font. In my screenshot you can see the selected font in my options and the unbearably-light version being used in diff.
fields.summary: Diff Ignores Font Weight & Style Selection

fields.description:
The display of merge conflicts are confusing to new / non-technical users. I propose a better warning system when your working copy has merge conflicts, for the sake of saving engineer's lives (If you have a soul, please help): Crazy red warning that changes background color of working copy display. Maybe additional markers in the UI to represent, "Hey, something's wrong."

Current issue: Merge conflicts only show up as an easily-dismissed dialogue with lots of text, and little markers next to items. Too many times to count, we've had artists/designers pull down the project, have a conflict, have the merge show up as expected (all local and remote modifications, plus conflicts marked with exclamations), and the user simply discards all of the files they didn't change (including all remote modifications in the merge), causing lost work and/or lots of engineer time to bring back the lost content.

By just adding a red background and a warning banner in this situation, it would make it incredibly easier to handle these situations on large teams, especially as we're bringing on lots of new users that have little or no git experience. Training helps, but these indicators will do wonders.
fields.summary: Git merge conflict improvement

fields.description:
When the commit view is set to 'Current Branch' and you switch from one branch to another the view doesn't properly update.

It looks like there are some timing issues between the branches sidebar and the diff view.

It takes the sidebar several seconds and several redraws to update. The commit view also updates a few times, however if the two branches are not related (aka branch 2 head is not visible from branch 1 when in Current Branch) it does not appear the commit view works correctly.

Work around is to click on different branches to explicitly refresh the screen, F5, or to always display 'All Branches' and for large repos with many many branches this is both slow and far to difficult to track your own changes.
fields.summary: Commit view gets out of sync when set to 'Current Branch' when switching branches

fields.description: We have had a number of reports of users installing 2.1.0-beta-2 and finding it a) didn't start and it potentially corrupted their GA install.
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.1 Beta unable to start after installation

fields.description:
If the SourceTree window is maximised on one monitor, it cannot be dragged to another monitor - this is inconsistent with every other application installed on my machine.

You either have to restore (i.e. un-maximise) the window first, move it and re-maximise it, or use the Windows 10 hotkeys: Win+right/left arrow.
fields.summary: If the window is maximised, it can't be dragged to another monitor

fields.description:
# Create a new tab
 # In 'Local Repositories', create a new folder
 # Right click the new folder, select Rename and give the folder a new name
 # Drag an existing git repository from Windows Explorer to the new repository folder in SourceTree.

The existing repository is correctly added to the folder, but the folder's name reverts to New Folder.
fields.summary: Dragging an existing repository onto a repository folder undoes a previous rename

fields.description:
I created a new Repository Folder. Initially it is called New Folder. In Windows Explorer, when you do this, you can then immediately rename the folder (because typically New Folder is not a useful name...)

SourceTree does not do this automatically - you have to right click and click Rename. F2 does not work.

Then, instead of automatically selecting the text so that when you type the existing name is replaced, the cursor is placed at the start of the text, so your name ends up as e.g. 'UtilsNew Folder'.

It's only a minor issue, but there are several irritating useability issues:
 # a new folder should be automatically put into edit mode - no one wants a folder called 'New Folder'
 # F2 should edit the currently selected folder's name
 # When editing a folder name, the whole of the current name should be selected, so that when you type the old name is replaced - pre-pending text to the name is not the correct default.
fields.summary: Unneccessarily difficult to create new repository folders

fields.description:
Text cursor is invisible on (1) screen in all textboxes.

If the window is on both screens then visibility depend on scaling.
fields.summary: invisible cursor

fields.description:
It is hard to describe, but with Sourcetree v2 font rendering quality was decreased.

(Screenshot)
fields.summary: Fonts are rendered "blury" in 2.0

fields.description:
When sourcetree is maximised and the Windows taskbar is set to "automatically hide the taskbar in desktop mode" in the taskbar settings, sourcetree stops the taskbar from appearing when the mouse is moved to the bottom of the screen, stopping access to other running applications/shortcuts.

 

As pointed out by RedX2501 below. This issue has been duplicated as SRCTREEWIN-7259 and SRCTREEWIN-7195 with varying degrees of priority.
fields.summary: Maximised sourcetree blocks access to hidden taskbar

fields.description: It would be really nice if SourceTree honored .mailmap settings/files in a repository so that Author information could be normalized in cases where users have used different variations of their names and/or email aliases during commits. This would also make the output consistent with git log options.
fields.summary: Honor .mailmap files

fields.description:
Please bring back the repository treeview. This is an important feature that I use all the time. With the current 2.x implementation, even if I click on the plus button to switch to other repositories, I can't see which ones have uncommitted changes. That defeats the whole purpose I am using SourceTree. At least I request that this be made an option for advanced users.

Our work uses many repositories simultaneously in the same project. Often there are changes to be checked in for multiple repositories. To see what repositories need check-ins made, I look at SourceTree. Without this feature my work becomes MUCH harder. I have to downgrade to 1.x until this feature is re-implemented in SourceTree.
fields.summary: Bring back repository treeview to 2.x releases

fields.description: I get the setup wizard on every update, even the small security fix today prompted me to go through everything again. I would expect this not to happen.
fields.summary: Setup Wizard on every update

fields.description:
Noticed when staging changes from files already in the staged files list. The staged files list lost files (1 out of 7 files) (still appeared in git status from command line). Refreshing via F5 caused the files to reappear immediately, disappear after a second and then reappear permanently a few seconds later thus restoring the view correctly.

The staging view is set to show only Pending, sorted by filename, alphabetic and Flat list multiple columns and Split view staging.

 

It is unknown what would have happened had I committed if the missing file would have been part of the commit or not.
fields.summary: Stage files disappear from staged view

fields.description:
Hello.
 Thanks for amazing Git client.
 I upgraded to 2.0.19.1 version and it's little frustrating:
 
 1. Log / History shows "Uncommited changes" even if git status in Terminal shows "nothing to commit". Similar issue when submodule repo is dirty but SourceTree doesn't show what exactly modified. Very annoying. Checkout with Discard All Changes doesn't help.

2. Where are the left-side panel? Don't tell me you deleted it :) Can you bring it back with optional disabling? It is very uncomfortable to open new Tab for open new repo. I have 1920 width screen and I don't need to remove this panel. Ctrl+B was good helper. Moreover new Repos Explorer is not Tree-Like which is unclearly for explore.
 
 Thanks
fields.summary: Uncomitted changes still showing / No sidepanel

fields.description:
!image-2017-05-08-12-39-29-644.png!

SourceTree Beta have enormous usage of RAM and cause poor system responsiveness.
fields.summary: Enormous usage of RAM.

fields.description: It shows error : Serwer zdalny zwrócił błąd: (404) Nie znaleziono. (in polish language) during attempt to download newest version of sourcetree directly from the app
fields.summary: Error during attempt to download newest version of beta sourcetree directly from app.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With Squirrel installer, SourceTree gets installed in {{%localappdata%}} folder and it's not possible for the users to change the installation location.

Some users would like to be able to do so, e.g. because this folder is protected by an antivirus and to start the program, they have to disable the scanner once.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to select the installation location for SourceTree.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to select the installation location for SourceTree

fields.description:
I have an additional worktree attached to a repository. When I view it in Sourcetree, no branches appear in the window on the left.

Tags, Remotes and Stashes all appear correctly.
fields.summary: Branches not display when viewing a worktree

fields.description: Previously, if tags containing forward slashes were treated like filenames and organised into folders. This no longer happens. Branches are still grouped however.
fields.summary: Tags no longer grouped in folders

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to pull the latest changes, without stashing or committing your own changes. On the GIT command-line, you can enter `git pull --autostash`, so GIT will automatically stash your changes, pull and pop the stash again.

Whenever SourceTree detects that you have pending changes, it could ask if you would like to use the autostash feature.
fields.summary: Add autostash option to pull

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some users have reported that after upgrading from version 1.9 to 2.0 of SourceTree, the Pull Requests they create from SourceTree generate an invalid link. This has been reported so far with Bitbucket Cloud repositories.

In those cases, if you go to a repository's {{Settings}}, select the Remote and then {{Edit}}, the {{Host Root URL}} field has the URL of the repository instead of [https://bitbucket.org/].
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unable to reproduce so far
h3. Workaround
 # Locate the file {{sourcetreeconfig}}, in the repository's {{.git}} folder.
 # Find the following part in this file:
{code:java}
<RemoteProjectLinks>
    <RepositoryRemoteProjectLink>
      <BaseUrl>https://www.bitbucket.org</BaseUrl>
{code}

 # In case the 'BaseUrl' is something other than 'https://www.bitbucket.org', edit it and replace it with [https://www.bitbucket.org|https://www.bitbucket.org/] like above.
 # Restart SourceTree
fields.summary: Upgrading from version 1.9 to 2.0 of SourceTree sometimes changes the Host Root URL for a repository

fields.description:
The repositories panel was a great way to get an overview of all of my projects at once, see where other developers had made changes and flick between them easily. The tab view is bloated and slow in comparison. I've always missed it on the rare occasion I've had to use my mac to compile an iOS project, but that's never been so much of an issue since I'm just working with one specific project at a time there.

Please add it back in, maybe with an option to show or hide it.
fields.summary: Add repositories panel back in

fields.description:
After updating to latest beta (2.1.0-beta-2 - using the update process) SourceTreewont start up any more:

    Neither the updated 2.1.0-beta-2 version
     *nor the previously working production 2.0.19.1 (???) version* (which shouldn't be affected by the update of beta version - correct?)

will start anymore. Within the taskmanager, the sourcetree tasks shortly appears - but disappears immediately - and nothing else happens (in both cases)

Downloading the installer for 2.1.0-beta-2, the same thing is happening: doubleclicking the installer, the installation task disappears immediately from taskmanager without any further action ...

Running Sourctree on Win7 Ultimate 64bit
fields.summary: After update: SourceTree wont start anymore

fields.description:
SourceTree for Windows is affected by a command injection vulnerability in URI handling. The vulnerability can be triggered through a browser or the SourceTree interface.

*Affected versions:*
* Versions of SourceTree for Windows starting with 0.8.4b before version 2.0.20.1 are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
 * Upgrade SourceTree for Windows to version 2.0.20.1 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/]

*Acknowledgements*
 We would like to credit Yu Hong for reporting this issue to us.

For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/jW2xNQ].
fields.summary: Command Injection (CVE-2017-8768)

fields.description:
When selecting a file in 'File Status' tab the code diff preview to the right is blurry for 0.5 to 1 second.

Issue is more pronounced on large code changes. When jumping between files quickly this causes me eye strain issues.

See slowed down screenshot for example.

!SRCTREEWIN-7160.gif!
fields.summary: Fix issue with blur on code diff window.

fields.description:
1) Select 2 commits

2) In search on the right type the filter text.  !image-2017-05-07-12-08-52-893.png!

3) List of files in diff remains unaffected.

The same, however, works perfectly for filtering unstaged.
fields.summary: Search (filter) does not work on diff view between two commits

fields.description:
When you try to update the embedded git (Tools -> Options -> Git -> Update Embedded Git) the update fails at the "extracting" step with a generic message if any of the embedded git programs are in use.

This is a commonly reported issue, e.g. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-3970 , https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-2863 , and many more.

There are a variety of reasons internal git programs would be in use:
 * user is using terminal (git bash)
 * user is using ssh keys in pageant
 * there is a hung git process from a previous operation this Windows session (due to, for instance, a fetch on a remote that was deleted)

Ways to deal with this before extracting, from simplest to best:
 * Save the download so at least you don't have to redo the download again to retry
 * *Show a message about quitting running git/terminal/pageant so at least users know what issue to look for*
 * Detect running embedded git programs and prompt the user to close them, continuing once they are closed
 * Detect running embedded git programs and automatically close them when safe
fields.summary: Deal with running embedded git programs before trying to extract embedded git update

fields.description: Updating from earlier version (1.8.3) of SourceTree removes custom command for external diff and merge. Reverts to default values. The .gitconfig file still has the user-defined values, but SourceTree does not pick these up.
fields.summary: Update of SourceTree removes custom external diff command

fields.description:
When opening a new tab, the list of local repositories is not a hierarchical list like the old bookmarks window. When you have dozens of repos, it is painful to find the one you want (particularly if they have similar or identical names) when the hierarchical view is no longer present.

Additionally, there are gobs of useless white space between the items on the flat list that reduces the number of items visible.

The old hierarchical bookmark view was one of the main reasons I used SourceTree. I would suggest strongly that you restore this view. Otherwise the program should be renamed SourceList :)

I'm going to revert to 1.8.3 as this was the last version that provided a useful list of repos, and was economical with mouse movements to stage files.
fields.summary: Restore hierarchical view when selecting repo to open

fields.summary: SourceTree fails to start due to PresentationFramework.Aero2 missing

fields.description:
Some files in a project have unix line endings (LF) and SourceTree is unable to show a diff in changes to those files. 

SourceTree also fails to open the diff using the "External Diff" menu item or CTRL+D.

The same diff manually opened using an external tool (WinMerge) shows the diff properly.

 

Attached screenshots illustrate the problem pretty well.
fields.summary: Diff for files with Unix Line endings (LF) shows nothing

fields.description:
Double Click Branch to checkout (switch).

Left Treeview updated.

Middle view was still 'blank' with integrated progress bar in progress. Assumed it was simply updating the branch view which can take some time.

Click Pull Button.

Resulting branch looked 'wrong'.

Checked git ref log: (Reported in latest actions first).

HEAD\{0}: pull origin A: Fast-forward

HEAD\{1}: checkout: moving from 'A' to 'B'

 

This is really bad as there are parts of the UI indicating I was on branch 'B' when I clearly wasn't. This is exceedingly dangerous especially for people who don't routinely dive into the reflog to see what they are doing any simply trust the tool to do the right thing.

 

When I tried pulling again without doing anything else.

HEAD\{0}: pull origin B: Fast-forward

HEAD\{1}: pull origin A: Fast-forward

HEAD\{2}: checkout: moving from 'A' to 'B'

 

SourceTree should either schedule operations to perform while operations are in flight or simply lock until an operation is complete.
fields.summary: Switching Branches followed by Pull appears to pull from original branch.

fields.description:
When looking at uncommitted changes, I have the option of selecting "external diff" from the context menu when I right-click on a changed file. It'd be nice to have the same ability when viewing changes made to a file during a commit.

The built-in diff doesn't work for some UTF16 files in my repo so I have to rely on an external diff tool.
fields.summary: Add "External diff" option to context menu upon right click of commit
Wireframes for look up
